results.title: Lo-Arna 1981
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Nottage, Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Women of the sun (A)”.
Part Four of the “Women of the Sun” series which presents events that occurred to four different aboriginal women, at different periods in time. This episode is set in 1981 and examines the inner turmoil and insecurity of an 18 year old girl when her adoptive parents tell her she is not of French Polynesian descent, but is the daughter of an Aboriginal woman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Nottage, Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films

results.title: One out of three is a fsihboat
results.creator_credit: Andy Thomson, Wolf Koenig, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A hard-hitting film suggesting that new attitudes and practices are needed in Canada’s fishing industry to protect the lives and property of those who work at sea. Accidents due to the unsafe condition of boats, bad habits of seamanship, fire or defects in safety equipment can be avoided. A ship safety inspector and instructors at New Brunswick’s School of Fisheries and Newfoundland’s College of Fisheries show where the roots of disaster can lie.
results.title_for_label: One out of three is a fsihboat
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andy Thomson, Wolf Koenig, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: One of many: Dr Nhan
results.creator_credit: Jan-Marie Martell, George Johnson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Dr. Nahn, an ethnic Chinese refugee from Vietnam, is one of the many “boat people” who emigrated to Canada in the late 1970’s. When she arrived in Vancouver she learned that although she had practiced acupuncture in Saigon for many years, British Columbia law would not recognise her profession. One of Many describes Dr. Nahn’s life and career prior to her arrival in Canada and documents her efforts to overcome the obstacles that prevent her from using her knowledge. The film leaves no doubt about Dr. Nahn’s commitment to people and medicine, and her determination to one day practice acupuncture in her new country. Voice and narration: Linda Uyrehara Hoffman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jan-Marie Martell, George Johnson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: This is a story about the land we live on
results.creator_credit: Alisha Dark, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: This land has cared for our ancestors for generations and now it’s our turn to care for it. We need to take responsibility. This story is about Alisha’s personal connection with the land.

results.title: One man's multinational
results.creator_credit: Ben Loeterman, Thomas Friedman and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description: Provides a history of the Bata shoe industry and then focuses on its operation as a multinational corporation. Raises issues surrounding the motivation behind the company’s installation of factories in Third World countries such as Kenya, highlighting the controversial nature of multinational corporations as such. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.
